title: When its ok to leave a game.
body: I had a game where i start out saying glhf :) in all chat immediately my volibear begins cussing me out. I ignore him. Then I'm suddenly jumped by mid lane and the enemy jungler with no mias. I wasn't expecting that and i did have wards i backed off but they out cced me and i couldn't survive. So i asked mid to please call mias. Then 1 minute later im jumped by the enemy jungler again this time next to my turret and die. Then it happened again with mid and no mias like 3 minutes later so i pinged mia mid a few times as a reminder and said call mias. I was told to stop feeding by the half afk mid who has even less cs than me with like 3 deaths at this point. So after i get ganked by the jungler again i am very upset. When mid and jungler shows up again for a total of 6 ganks in under ten minutes and i have not even been playing aggressive and get no help or mias while being abused by my team of premades i left and said report me if you want fuck you all in all chat. I'm not sorry. There are games you should leave.

replies.body: There needs to be a fuck you ill do what i want option for this stupid leaver thing comment instead of I Agree. Cause i don't agree. If Im being camped with no help while my own team sabotages me i will leave every time. I will not be forced to waste my time in a game that is a literal hostage situation.
Then you'll agree to be punished for leaving the game. You either agree to the rules and consequences or you don't play League.

So its ok with riot that i get trolled by a 4 man and that they take me hostage but if i leave that's not ok? That's literally short bus extra chromosome retarded, and they should learn that no one will tolerate that. Anyone who does, doesn't place any worth on themselves.

When you click "Play", and queue up for a match, you are agreeing to the Terms of Use and Summoner's Code - both of which prohibit "giving up" or leaving a game early. The **only** exception where it is permissible is if the team votes for a(n early) surrender. Unless a nexus has fallen, you are not permitted to AFK. If you can't have fun unless you're winning/carrying, don't play League, because I guarantee you you won't always be winning/carrying. Use the time you're in a losing game to sit back and practice defense, that way you can hopefully come back, but if not, you're still better off than you started.

This is your fair warning, further, that jokes about mental illness or using such words as a form of hate speech will **not** be tolerated on the boards, and if you use them again will result in deletion and suspension. If you're going to try to discuss this here, you need to do so respectfully and maturely.

You are the kind of person that gives ea a pass on loot boxes get the fuck out of my thread and never respond to any again. Riot games has a horrible policy i wont play a game that lets people troll me and get away with it. Riot cares more about if you leave or say something mean than if you actually actively ruin games.

>You are the kind of person that gives ea a pass on loot boxes

Incoming from left field.

>You are the kind of person that gives ea a pass on loot boxes get the fuck out of my thread and never respond to any again.

Not your decision. It's a public board, members of the community are allowed to respond so long as they aren't breaking the rules.

If you're going to leave a game just because you don't like your teammates or you're not doing well in the game, you're going to have to accept the penalties of turning the game into a 4v5.

Not much you can do if teammates do not ping, but looking at the match in question, it was 21 min long, you placed 5 wards, and bought 0 control wards.

You can't always trust your teammates to ping MIA, but you can drop wards to help your vision to help prevent ganks.
Except i bought 2 control wards and placed 5 normal wards, probly more.
Your inability to see the map, or ward, does not excuse your AFKing. Be better. It's that simple.

You are always "allowed" to leave, in that doing so is physically possible, and as a reasoning person you can decide to take that action after considering the risks and rewards.

The risks associated with that action are Nothing (if you almost never ever leave), LPQ (low priority queue, if you leave regularly) and if you make it a horribly horribly often habit of it, your account can be banned for it.

The potential rewards are your own to decide.
---------------
With that said, it sounds like you took a minor issue with them not pinging and escalated it into completely ruining a match. Was that the outcome you desired?

If that wasn't the outcome you wanted, could you have done anything differently?
